intro: Senna artemisioides nothosubsp. coriacea, commonly known as the hairy senna, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its bipinnate leaves, which are covered in fine, hairy structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are typical of the Fabaceae family. Its seeds are enclosed in long, slender pods and are often used in traditional medicine. The species is adapted to thrive in harsh environments, making it an important component of local flora.
